problem_text:
a) Let G(q) be a simple Chevalley group over a field of order q. Prove that there exists m such that the restriction of every non-one-dimensional complex representation of G(qm) to G(q) contains all irreducible representations of G(q) as composition factors.
A. E. Zalesskii
answer: This is proved in (D. Gluck, J. Algebra, 155, no. 2 (1993), 221–237).
